WRITING.TITLE: [Feedback] The profile feature leans more towards what Tumblr or Facebook would do...
WRITING.TEXT:
Reddit is unique because of it numerous aspects. But one thing that I love about it is its anonymity and its community.
But if in the foreseeable future people start promoting their profiles to make them look impressive, than there won't be any contribution to the actual discussion.
Plus the activity feature for me is quite unsettling, because I don't want anyone to know what I'm doing on the sight...
TBH I'm a bit confused with the beta even after being around it for ~4-5 months.
Man, thank you for your time... and good luck with whatever your dealing with.

WRITING.TITLE: Mother and daughter slaughtering a pig

WRITING.TEXT: Yeah I know. But Lassiz's view d.va was on point. Although I really think something was wrong.

Yes, many characters have evolved. But going from 'Raiding undiscovered lands and benefitting Kattegat', to 'Raiding lands and become famous/well-known' is kind of an odd way to evolve for a character like Ragnar.
And idk you might be right. But after all he is dead, and we'll never find out.
If that's the case...then why was Ragnar talking about how he would be in Valhalla after his execution?
And I do agree that the show is sometimes weird with their sequences.

The Seer did warn Bjorn that Ragnars arrival would bring chaos to Kattegat. Plus Ragnar visited Lagertha, talked to her and even kissed her whilst ignoring Aslaug the whole time. This indicates that Ragnar loves Lagertha. (Plus he wanted to see her before he 'dies', because he said that he'll travel to England to die. I also believe that Lagertha wants to kill Aslaug because she saw her performing some ritual.
Ok thnx
I will try, but I don't think they will be able to help. Fuck the points, I just want to bring up this issue to the community/blizzard.
50 points gone.

I feel the same way as you. But I still fucking love the show. In short: The show went from historic accuracy + action to having more freedom with changing historic events and adding a shit ton of drama

I do understand where you are coming from. But if you recall, in season 1, Ragnars intentions weren't to become famous, but instead to become rich and expand viking settlements. That is why during season 1 his main goal was to travel west and loot the lands.
And I don't think referring to historical records would be good in this case. Because after all in reality Rollo isn't Ragnar's brother. And Ragnar has over 10 children. The show has created many extra elements to the show to make it more entertaining.

Although Ragnar started to 'doubt' his gods, I really do think that in the inside he still believes in them. Just like his brother Rollo, who converted to Christianity and now is a prince amongst them (Christians). But deep inside, he still believes in the Vikings. He even said to his wife (Gisla) that she would hear thunder but he still hear's the God Thor beating his hammer.
I feel like there is a very strange connection between the two brothers. They seem to doubt their fate quite often, but they still believe in their viking gods, Valhalla.....in the inside.
And yes I actually do believe that Ragnar is blaming the Christian god on Athelstan's death. And that, in my opinion is why he ordered his son Ivar to seek revenge on Ecbert.
Yeah. I saw that facebook post soon after I posted this one.
Thank u for ur time
